website_summaries.verdict: If the ThunderShirt works for your dog, it is an easy-to-use alternative to other types of calming products.
pros: Patented design that's recommended by many trainers and veterinarians
Delivers gentle pressure that reduces anxiety – almost like giving your dog a hug
Available in XX Small to XX Large
cons: Won't work for all dogs, but is estimated to be effective for about 80% that have worn it
Prone to rips with repeated use, especially by over-active canines

customer_reviews.title: More Comfortable Than Original
customer_reviews.text: My dog has used the original Thundershirt in the past, but the material was way too hot. She'd be al sweaty under it and panting. She has a serious fear of storms, so I decided to try the new breathable sport version. It's lighter, more giving (moves with her), and much cooler than the original yet still works well. She can actually relax & fall asleep in this one.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working!!!  Yay!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received today...My 6 yr. old..red-nosed female pit seemed to be ready to " crawl out of her skin" at times....it's quite disturbing! This calmed her down immensely...she has paced..but allows me to pet her without turning away...even placed her head on my arms and closed her eyes! In the past, I felt so bad for her..I am hoping continued serenity for her..she deserves it! As do I!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine G.

customer_reviews.title: Nope

customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and fast shipping. Put it on my dog and she seemed to calm done almost instantly. I'm glad I decided to invest in her. It has helped with her fear and anxiety when thunder or storms are near. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Product Quality = 0
customer_reviews.text: My dog wore this jacket twice for a few hours each time. She liked having it on and it fit well (she is a Cocker Spaniel and I purchased a size medium). Within 6 hours the Velcro on the underside (belly) of the jacket began unraveling and wearing through the fabric. Also got a hole in the fabric, not sure how this happened, maybe a belly scratch or getting caught on something in the yard or getting caught on the unraveling Velcro. Amazon, as usual, great to work with for return and refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Tore during first use
customer_reviews.text: The material used for this Thundershirt is imprinted using some kind of heat process to make the design and causes the material to be incredibly weak along these lines. My dog tore it after wearing it once and added two more tears when I tried it a second time. The tears were all along the heat seam lines. I have other Thundershirts made from different materials and have no problems with those. I would not recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: ReadMoreEatLess

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money !!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE!!! Between my boyfriend and I we have bought 3 of these thunder shirts in the last month I just received mine on 2/25 today is 2/28 and it is already ripped and the velcro doesn’t stick..I will never purchase another one as I’ve spent over $100 on these in the last month and they don’t even last a week !!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Did not work

Then a storm hit and he was the same crazed stressed dog. This absolutely no effect on him so it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Janet vb

customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that has random bouts of separation anxiety if in the crate over 3 hours (NOTE: she's old enough to be in the crate longer than 3 hours and I tried NOT leaving her in the crate and she doensn't like being outside the crate either, so it's a mystery to figure out). Anyway, she wears this thundershirt whenever she goes into the crate sprayed with calming pheremones on the black circle and she's doing better. Not sure if it's the pheremone spray, rescue remedy, or the thundershirt, but she wears the thundershirt everytime she's in the crate and it's working, so I'm sticking with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just got it for my sisters dog

If she is being mean to our other dog we put it on. I compare it to swaddling blanket for a baby. The material makes her feel “ swaddled”,safe & calm. Highly recommend!

Be patient and BUY THIS.

It’s like putting a Velcro sweater on my dog, I don’t get how it was supposed to make him feel better but I thought I’d give it a shot as I was desperate. Unfortunately this simply doesn’t work. I’d question purchasing this if I were you.

I will ALWAYS recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: travis kruso

customer_reviews.author: aljarn

customer_reviews.author: Shannon L Williams

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.text: I have a washed out police dog/German Shepherd (he got shot) who is terrified of fireworks and thunder. TERRIFIED. I don’t want to drug him so I tried this. Plus we were going to travel and he didn’t do well in cars. Not sure why it’s supposed to work, but he just seemed upset that he was wearing it while he was scared. I saw no effect. Used it several times but Fargo didn’t seem to understand it either. As to the best- very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Munn

customer_reviews.title: Works great, snags easily
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my sweet girl. I have a former shelter dog who has separation anxiety and this helps a lot. My only complaint is that I have to be careful not to let the fabric touch the Velcro. This fabric snags easily. If that were not the case, I'd give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M

customer_reviews.title: It actually worked
customer_reviews.text: Whippets are very sensitive dogs. sensitive to nasty looks, to raised voices, to noise. I really doubted that this would have any effect. They are tearing off and replacing the entire building envelope of my condo. Banging on the outside walls, tearing them apart. Poor Dylan was vibrating. The first day he kept vibrating with the shirt on. Then he started slowing down. A week into it, he lays down and sleeps. He still gets a bit worried, but no more vibrating. I would call it a total success.
customer_reviews.author: N. Knack

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a believer!! My dog is very nervous with loud noises- storms- fireworks. I received the thunder shirt yesterday. I was thrilled it would be here prior to July 4th. He was borderline on size so I went with the next one up and it’s a great fit. Tonight I put it on him- I didn’t have high hopes. Normally he shakes, pants, paces and just seems miserable with fireworks. The thunder jacket kept him so calm. I’m seriously shocked it works so well. The next test will be trying it during a storm. I would definitely recommend this product. The material is soft and light.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Boblitt

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical when purchased, but jacket really does help
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical when purchased. Had to try something for our baby girl. Shaking, panting etc. This jacket reduces her shaking to almost none. She still paces and pants , but it really does help. I would definitely recommend. Be sure to purchase the spray pheromone for the jacket also
customer_reviews.author: Kim Steager

customer_reviews.title: Nice thing is we can send it back
customer_reviews.text: Our dog still was shaking and trying to find a quiet area in the house. Nice thing is we can send it back. Bummer it did not work for our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little more serene...
customer_reviews.text: Is a great comfort coat for my dog a Labradoodle. He’s just terrified of thunder. I don’t know why maybe it’s because he was born on the hills of the Colorado mountains and then he moved to Brooklyn to be with me. I guess there must’ve been an event when he was running around as a puppy maybe somebody got hit by lightning? He was traumatized by the electricity? But anyway, the coat calms him down quite a bit —it’s not 100% effective—but he does act a little more serene when he’s wrapped up in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly... it actually works.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the efficacy of this product, particularly for my hyper-analytical/intelligent herding dog. My poor pup had a terrifying experience with thunder early in life and has been scared of lightning storms ever since. This jacket really does pacify her. She’s still unnerved when storms roll though, but more likely to relax and nap without shaking or experiencing tremors. It’s not a perfect solution, but it seems to console her at least as well as my company and embrace. The price seems awfully high given the simple nature of the jacket, but the effect on my best friend is totally worth it. If your dog suffers from thunder related anxiety, I strongly endorse this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R.

customer_reviews.title: OMG. It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the XXS for a 5lb 14 week old Chug puppy. I just got her a week ago and noticed that she was overly emotional when I would get home from work. She would cry and jump all over the place. Her poor heart would be pounding out of her chest. This little jacket is like magic. It's snug, but not too tight; It's breathable, so her skin and fur aren't suffering. She's her normal playful self when I get home now. She doesn't need the jacket when I'm home, so she simply wears it for the 9 hours I'm gone each day.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Was afraid to write this!
customer_reviews.text: After three weeks of using the thundershirt on our recently anxious 8 year old dog, I can say that it works. When our dog began to howl at night when separated from us (she always welcomed her bed and separate sleeping are before), we were out of options. We tried comforting, raising our voices, and reassuring her, but nothing worked except for a bark collar. We didn't like that option and tried the thundershirt. The first night, she was quiet and comfortable. I can hardly wake her in the morning! After two days without it, she begins to howl again. She now wears it every night, and we think she really likes it!
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Instantly calm
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect color for my brindle coat boxer/lab mix. She absolutely loves it and within 5 minutes of wearing it, she is noticeably more calm. This is not the wool type material the original Thundershirts are, which is great because my dog isn’t hot and panting like other dogs seem to do when wearing the original ones. I would definitely recommend this to anybody with a hyper or anxious dog.
customer_reviews.author: Tony P.

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong With This Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but fabulous things to say about this product. Our crybaby is an 90 lb boxer mix. When we have a storm he pants, shakes, jumps on and off the bed, tries to be a lap dog and paces around the house. Talk about a sleepless night! With his Thundershirt Sport on he lays down and acts as though he is aware of the storm but as long as my husband and i are in the room with him he is cool, calm and collected. He is 90 lbs and the thundershirt fis true to size. I ordered an extra large. It is very soft. I think he likes to wear it!.
customer_reviews.author: nancy tyndell

customer_reviews.title: Size might be an issue
customer_reviews.text: I love this but buyers might be interested in a sizing issue. Our dog is 15 lbs with a chest circumference of 19 inches. We bought two. A small from Amazon and an x-small from another source. We kept the small even though it’s not quite small enough. The x-small doesn’t reach around his chest at all. A rather big disparity in size between the two. The photo shows both shirts. I lined them up at the neck so you can see the size difference. I gave it five stars anyway because it is well made, light weight, nice looking, and our dog loves wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Drkevbo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Truly an amazing change in our dog!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Just wow. This has saved my dog's life and the other dogs around her. We have a pug and she was out of control. Our other two dogs hatted her and we didn't know where else to turn. Immediately upon wearing the thunder jacket her anxiety and crazy ws cured. She was a new dog! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron D.

customer_reviews.title: She did not like the first
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of a Thundershirt for our dog. She did not like the first, heavier one, and it has disappeared (we think she buried it 8-D). This "Sport" model is a lighter weight version. Rather than running away, she comes to us to put it on when we pick it up. It gives her the same "hug" as the heavier one, but it seems to give her more flexibility to move around. She is a rescue who has serious issues with loud noises, especially loud thunder. This version of the Thundershirt seems to work well for her. I would recommend this product, even over the original version.
customer_reviews.author: M P

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it works
customer_reviews.text: My dog went missing for 4 days after a thunderstorm. I had already tried prescription anti-anxiety meds and CBD oil without success. I was desperate for something to work. It's currently thundering again and my dog is just relaxing in his Thudershirt. I'm still in shock. Update: Right after this picture was taken, my dog pushed through the backdoor and dug under the newly reinforced fenced gate. Thankfully he was easy to spot in his colorful Thundershirt.
customer_reviews.author: Andoria

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this....update: I’ve had this for 3 mths and  one of the Velcro strips has alrdy ripped. Very disappointed!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this!!! My dog is very high strung and this jacket has saved me from going insane. If your dog or cat has separate anxiety or any other anxiety,this is the jacket to get. Try this before you take your animal to the vet and pay god Awful prices for the visit and for the medicine they will prescribe to them.update: This ripped after 3 mths!! Very disappointed in this high dollar purchase!!! Would have been cheaper to make one!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Anxious Dog LOVES this!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog gets really bad anxiety from everything from being itchy to lights and shadows (she's super special LOL). She hides when she feels like this and it makes me so sad. Nothing calms her down except for when I give her a big squeeze hug. I was super curious to try this because it's supposed to feel like a hug. We've been trying this for the past 2 weeks and SHE LOVES IT! When she's freaking out and I grab it, she gets so excited to put it on. Plus the pink color is way too cute and the fabric is so soft and breathable. I never thought something would work for her but this does!!!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use; quality materials
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product as an anxiety-reducing garment for thunderstorms for my dogs for years. However, in this case, I used it to cover parts of my 12-year-old terrier's body when she had a surgical procedure which resulted in stitches on her side. I hate those clunky plastic cones, so I decided to just "COVER" the incision safely and cleanly. The garment keeps her from chewing her stitches, is easy to get on and off, and could be washed (I have several of them for her) quickly and easily. In addition, the "comforting" aspect of the garment is an added plus. The use of the Thundershirt has been a great tool in aiding her comfort, safety, and recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Nose in a book

customer_reviews.title: Sporty Handsome Thundershirt. I sized down this time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a size XL Thundershirt for my 60ish Lb Lab several years ago. It worked pretty well. Still nervous but I believe it helped him somewhat in storms and fireworks. After many years the Velcro started to wear out so I decided to try this sporty Thundershirt in a Large. It fits him much more snuggly and he seemed to think he looks good in it. We think he does. Hopefully the smaller snugger fit will help him more.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Like others on here I was very skeptical that this would work for my dog. Well I am skeptical no more. I followed the directions and put it on her several times before we had any thunderstorms. Since then when I hear a storm approaching I say let’s get your thunder shirt, and she gets right up on the chair and lets me wrap her up in it. She lays calmly on the chair with me, no more heavy panting, no more fearful drooling, no more incredibly uncontrollable trembling. Thank you Thundershirt!!
customer_reviews.author: LStJames

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, cute and stands out
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of this ThunderShirt for my German Shepherd. It is sturdy and so cute. It has a silver reflective strip. I had bought a different shirt before and it was like t-shirt material and tore up quickly. This is like a quilted material so it seems that it will last longer. And the strips of Velcro are many. Love it, recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!!!
customer_reviews.text: it actually works. Sophie is much calmer during fireworks or Thunder storms. We put it on before the events happen and she settles down until the event has passed. Before the Jacket she just quivered all the time and her heart raced, which couldn't be good for her.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey P. Maslin

customer_reviews.title: I may be imagining it but he seemed slightly better. There wasnt as much fireworks this year as ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog still jumped every time he heard a firework. I may be imagining it but he seemed slightly better. There wasnt as much fireworks this year as in years past, they outlawed them this year in our town, so that might have really been it. To be honest, for the price, if it wasnt for my overly optimistic wife who believes anything, i would send it back and say it doesnt work.....too expensive for what it does. She bought one for my daughters lab and i have gotten a review from her yet. Its a dog coat and i sell dog coats myself that i buy wholesale for about $2 so they are overpriced...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Works!!!!! I put it on my boy when there was no storm threat. So he wouldn't associate with only scary storms. He loves it! Hops up on the grooming table and we put it on! No struggle! He dips his head and on it goes! Easy to put on. Make sure it is close fitting and wrap snuggley. Not tight. Like swaddling a baby! He feels safe and secure! If he hears thunder now? He will whimper once....I say...It's okay Thunder.....Momma's here, Go to sleep! And he does! With a name like Rolling Thunder....you would think a thunder storm would not be a big deal. Well, not anymore! He is comfy in his Thunder Shirt! No more sleepless nights!
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My dog normally goes crazy when he hears thunder: barking, running around, grabbing a bone immediately and shaking as well. But once we got the thunder jacket and put it on him, he’s calmed down immensely during thunder storms. He will still try to come sit beside me but he doesn’t say a word anymore! The thunder jacket also fits him really nicely and the compression seems to be helping a lot. Love this jacket!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Zito

customer_reviews.title: May work for some but not my dog
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after being desperate to try to help my dog with her anxiety over thunderstorms and fireworks. I purchased the large. My dog a 62 pound Catahoula leopard dog and it did fit her well. It did not work help her with her anxiety. I did try it several times thinking it may take some time make her more comfortable with it. I think it made her more nervous and anxious. I ended up using some CBD oil instead. I know it does work for some dogs, just not mine :-(
customer_reviews.author: Lilsis

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic.
customer_reviews.text: Our wire fox terrier sometimes gets a bit hyper and wants to zoom around the house just around midnight (or when guests come over). This jacket is like dog valium. It's amazing. Magical. Don't know how it works, but work, it does. (Just don't use it so often that your dog becomes used to it and the magic wears off; we generally use it only at night, right at bedtime, or w/company.) Easy to get on and off (though the dog doesn't like the sound of the velcro pulling apart, so we have to give her plenty of treats during donning and doffing). Well made and durable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anon1234

customer_reviews.title: it worked for us
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs is afraid of fireworks, and we live in a neighborhood where lots of people like to illegally celebrate for weeks around the 4th of July. Prior to using the Thundershirt, our dog would hide and shake in fear of the sound. This year we tried putting her in the Thundershirt at twilight each night, and removing the shirt around 1 am when the noise died down. She seemed to notice the fireworks, but she didn't look for a hiding place nor did the shake in fear.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this after a friend recommended it to help with my dog's fear of thunderstorms. It really works! It also works to help with his separation anxiety and his minimize his reactions when he hears noises outside. I love this and am so happy that it calms his fears. I wish I had known about it to help calm/relax my previous fur family member (a chihuahua) who lived with me for seventeen years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good - not Great
customer_reviews.text: I had never used one of these and my neurotic mutt is terrified of the trains that run behind our home (no whistle blowing either), scarred of thunder and petrified of fireworks. This doesn't solve any of those neurosis's that she has. It does help with her pacing and prowling around the house at night and she sleeps better. That is the reason for the three stars. It is quality made with quality materials and easy on/off. My neurotic mutt has a fenced yard, wish I could help ease some of her fears.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Fiction

customer_reviews.title: Strange Voodoo
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, we were skeptical that something like this would work on our little pooch (we have a Maltese/Yorkie mix). We put it on today and he actually seemed a bit calmer and more confident than his usual nervous self. Our little guy usually whines and claws at the door when our son l(to whom he is bonded) leaves the house, but today just calmly sat by the door with his little vest. Not sure what kind of voodoo is in this thing, but it seems to be working well so far. Will update as we've used it a bit more (during crate time at night).
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Miracle for NYC’s Summer of Endless Fireworks!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Thunder Shirt Sport in size Small for my 10-year-old and 10-month-old Frenchies! The fireworks are out of control here in Harlem, causing my geriatric Frenchie to react severely to the loud booms happening all through the evening and into the night. My puppy calms down SIGNIFICANTLY at night with the shirt on (read: no more jumping off of my body like a maniac while I’m trying to unplug and rest from the day!). My dogs both sleep soundly in these shirts, which instantly calm them down. I also use the Thunder Shirt spray—the essential oil blend smells amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It worked for my anxious dog!
customer_reviews.text: It goes on easy- didn’t have to wrestle her (my dog) to get it on. She was fine with it. I don’t know how or why, but it seems to help lower her anxiety. I don’t keep it on her all the time, but I do keep it on for a week or so during & after I come back from a vacation, or after events like July 4th when she freaks over fireworks. Plus, I love the hot pink color. It’s smooth to the touch, doesn’t snag. I haven’t tried washing it yet, but I haven’t had to yet- seems fairly stain resistant, even though she loves to rub in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Petrinelli

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried this on two dogs for two situations. One dog afraid of fireworks and one dog with separation anxiety. I did not notice a difference in either case. But I'm keeping it b/c vets make you jump through hoops before prescribing anything. That way I can say yes, I've tried Thundershirt, lavender essential oils, benadryl, soothing music, solliquin, high carbs, lots of exercise, blah, blah, blah... Clearly this works for many people. Just not for my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: SusieL

customer_reviews.title: Stop her panting and shivering
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about how well the Thunder sport would work. Well worth the purchase. Last night my dog was panting and shivering because of the fireworks. Put the thunder shirt on her tonight. No panting, no shivering and laying relaxed. It really keeps her anxiety down. I also have been using calming chews both nights. I was planning on getting a sedative from the vet for her. So glad that I don't have to now. Goes on easy and fits well.
customer_reviews.author: crazipainter

customer_reviews.title: since he calmed down in annoying Christmas sweaters
customer_reviews.text: We had an inkling that our Shiba Inu would calm down in a thunder shirt, since he calmed down in annoying Christmas sweaters. But he would get so overheated in the sweaters so we were looking for a more light weight option. This thunder shirt worked great! We are so happy with our cuddly calm dog.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dog cooler than the original ThunderShirt with same great effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should, calms my dog down almost immediately when it goes on and keeps her cooler than the original Thundershirt. My dog gets bad anxiety attacks and goes and hides under beds or other tight spaces and shakes, once I got her the ThunderShirt original she calms down instantly and now instead of hiding when she gets anxiety she knows to go right where I keep her shirt! Since we live in Florida this is perfect for the heat especially in the summer!
customer_reviews.author: Sean D.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t know how but IT WORKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It WORKS. There is no bigger skeptic than myself and I did not think there was any chance this piece of stretchable cloth would ease the anxiety (panting, shaking, terror) suffered by an otherwise well adjusted dog, caused by 6 hours/night of illegal fireworks but thank God - it works.
customer_reviews.author: Harlems Finest

customer_reviews.title: Didn't help much with anxiety but my puppy loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old Australia Cattle dog/border collie mix has very bad anxiety with any loud noise, and it gets especially bad in thunderstoms. We bought this to try out for him just to see if it helped at all, unfortunately it didn't. But he absolutely loves wearing it and fights me when I go to take it off him. He's 44lbs and we got him a large which fits perfectly, with a lot of wiggle room if needed. Even though it doesn't help with his anxiety I'm glad I got it just because he's so happy when he wears it.
customer_reviews.author: Yazmin

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, just not for my kiddos
customer_reviews.text: I though they were easy to put on and they fit well (XL for 85lb chocolate lab, M for 35lb mutt), but my dogs were more anxious about their shirts than the fireworks (even when trying to acclimate them before and after this past holiday). May just be because they don't get dressed up, ever. Returned to Amazon (check out the warehouse deals for used ones if you're on the fence about buying!). Extra calming chews for them, an extra slug of whiskey for me....
customer_reviews.author: ~heavv~

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe it worked
customer_reviews.text: My dog has severe car anxiety (pacing, panting, whining) and I have tried everything, treats, clickers, collars, 1 on 1 training with a dog trainer, cbd, and nothing really seemed to help. The first time i put this on her and put her in the car I couldn't believe it. My dog has NEVER been silent in the car before, and while she still panted, she sat in one place and barely made a sound. The second time I took her in the car, she laid down on her own, which again has never happened in the history of car rides. I'm still in shock over what a huge difference it made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I so wanted this to work...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to be one of those success stories on here that this worked for but after giving it a week and a half, it did absolutely nothing but teach my dog to run from the sound of velcro. He has separation anxiety in our new house and does not like when we leave. I would wake up, put the jacket on him, and hope he'd be calm by the time we had left the house that morning. But he never was. And the poor thing was miserable in the jacket. So we gave up. 2 stars because the jacket was a proper fit and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Winford

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective for Brittany Spaniel, male, 8 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived Prime, 1 day, so great service, thank-you. This is ineffective for my male, Brittany Spaniel. He has had no calming response and this is only Florida summer thunderstorms. Terrifying for him with the Thundershirt on. I can only hope the fireworks are somewhat diminished with this product. I had certainly anticipated his ‘deep sigh of relief’ while wearing it. Congratulations to all those fur babies who snuggle up, safe and sound! <3
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes, but it just didn’t seem to work for my pups. I have a pitbull & an Australian Shepard with separation anxiety. I will admit that it does seem to have calmed them down a little, but they still ripped up one of there beds while my husband and I were out. I’m keeping the vests for now because I am trying them along with calming treats to see if that’ll do the trick. They are lightweight & my dogs seem comfy with them on
customer_reviews.author: veronica

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping through fireworks!
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab mix rescue dog. Since the day we adopted her she's been nervous around people and freaked out by rain and fireworks. She hides in a bathroom and shakes during rain storms / fireworks. I purchased the Thunder Shirt the week before 4th of July. I put It on her several times and gave her a treat. Made it a fun thing. A few days before the 4th, we had a series of medium storms. Put the vest on her. She still hid in the bathroom but wasn't shaking. I did the same thing before fireworks on the 4th. She hid in the bathroom but wasn't shaking. She fell asleep!
customer_reviews.author: DuaneWrites

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We have a two year old boxer mix who was a rescue. She has high anxiety and gets really wound up in the evenings. We wanted a different solution other than just ‘time out’ In her crate. We put this on her and she’s an entirely different dog! Cuddles and relaxed. She doesn’t like putting it on but it has really helped her calm down. Even when we don’t put it on her now, we have seen a huge improvement. I would highly recommend and will purchase again if necessary but we have had this for about 8 months and it’s in great condition. It’s well made and the Velcro is great for adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Kfarm

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I am not gonna lie... I was very skeptical. I thought no way will this work as my Lovey has major anxiety and nothing seems to help other than drugs. BUT this actually works. I am guessing it helps control their breathing similar to humans when we have anxiety. It takes about 5-10 minutes once we put it on her but she really does calm down, as we say... she is mush when she has it on. Just lays down and falls asleep. Very easy to use. I would recommend this product to anyone with a dog with high anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy P.
